What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

options: virtual seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Good foundation in calculus - topics like derivatives, basic integration, intro to differential equations and how to apply it to real-world situations
intro to calculus
I gained an understanding of derivatives and integrals, as well as mastering topics related to these areas of Calc 1.
Calculus; mastery-based learning
My Calculus 1 skills were strengthened...
I gained a better understanding of the workings of calculus.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Mastery-based learning is amazing and helped me learn much more efficiently than the standard grading methods in other classes. The professor (James) is also a major plus. The course is very well structured and organized, so honestly I can't think of any weaknesses.
-Excellent grading system still feel like I am really learning the material but no stress involved
This class was structured to really allow students to focus on mastering content, and I really preferred this style of teaching.
Great mastery-based pedagogy

Some strengths of the course was the mastery based learning - because of this, I valued learning the material much more than I valued the grade. Weaknesses of the course was... the confusion over the mastery-based learning system.

The strength is the mastery grading system which allows multiple chances. However, towards the end, it is concerning that your grade may be greatly affected if you can't achieve the last couple masteries. Additionally, the amount of assignments due every week was difficult to manage with other classes, but the professor was generous and understanding, so that allowed the workload to level out.

I think the professor and his grading system were strengths. I believe that mastery-based grading forced me (in a way) to relearn the material that I wasn't understanding instead of accepting my fate of getting a bad grade. The professor was a big strength because I felt comfortable approaching my professor and was engaged in class because he was able to make the classroom environment good.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: -Dr. Barnes did everything perfect
Being able to access documents and notes virtually was really helpful in studying.
Jam boards were fun

The successful practices include his drop in office hours, it was really helpful to be able to just come in whenever and ask any questions I had. A COVID-19 practice that could be improved could be... well, nothing really. It was a perfect class.
The virtual, recorded lecture was very helpful and office hours were highly valuable.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely! If you're just starting out with calculus or have some experience but are pretty rusty, this is a great course! I think it's well-paced and there are ample opportunities for student success.
definitely. Excellent teacher
I would definitely recommend this class because it has been structured to support students and focus on mastering content.
Yes, good intro calc course
I would recommend this course to another student! It was easy to understand the course material, as it was all laid out very clearly in an organized fashion.

I would recommend this course to another student as it is well-structured. However, I would warn the student that they should supplement their lecture learning with the textbook as it clarifies concepts.
Yes because the professor and grading really made this class enjoyable but academically challenging.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: -Office hour, peer tutor hours
N/A
The lectures were all virtual and live but they were also recorded.
The lecture was also recorded.
I mainly attended live, virtual lecture, but would watch recorded lecture if I was absent/needed to review material.
